results.title: Toni
results.brief_description:
Toni, an immigrant Italian worker in Provence, falls in love with Josepha but she is already engaged to somebody else. Out of spite, he takes up with Marie and both weddings are celebrated on the same day. Toni and Josepha meet up years later, both unhappy in their respectives mariages. The result is a crime of passion. Following the example of Marcel Pagnol, Renoir completely abandoned the studio and filmed exclusively outdoors and in genuine interiors in the Midi, using authentic sound and actors from the region. The film is remarkable for its avoidance of the melodramatic, the depth and fluidity of the camerawork and the feeling for figures in a landscape. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Director, Jean Renoir ; writers, Jean Renoir, Carl Einstein ; photography, Claude Renoir ; music, Paul Bozzi.
Cast: Charles Blavette, Jenny Helia, Edouard Delmont, Max Dalban, Andrex, Celia Montalvan.

results.title: Tongpan
results.brief_description: This documentary re-enactment made following the 1973 student rebellion which toppled the military junta in Thailand, is based on the experiences of a farmer from the poverty stricken north eastern region. It portrays the political and cultural gap that exists between peasant realities and the good intentions of the intelligentsia. In Thai with English subtitles.

results.title: Tone, Touch and Technique for the Young Pianist
results.creator_credit: Television Production Unit Centre for the Study of Higher Education and University of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Max Cooke brings to life the theories of posture, gesture and co-ordination, which lead to ease and beauty in piano playing. Explanations about muscular control, finger action, the role of the arms and sense of touch lead directly to exercises for specific aspects of performance, and these in their turn lead to the application of the skills acquired in actual music examples.

results.title: Tone poem: moods in the forest
results.creator_credit: African Film Productions and South Africa Railways
results.brief_description: A short colonial film that contrasts a woman collecting flowers in a dense South African forest with men logging the forest around her. The images are complimented by a musical arrangement by Michael Dorre conducting the Johannesburg Colosseum Symphony Orchestra. The film concludes with a title “Thus the sun illumined forests of the Cape”

results.title: Tomorrow: the thinking machine
results.creator_credit: Thomas Wolf, CBS Television, Rene Bras and Nicholas Webster
results.brief_description: A report on the only two known objects in the universe that seem capable of reasoning - the human brain and the electronic computer. Leading scientists display a computer that seems to learn as a child learns, writes a television play and plays draughts - and wins.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thomas Wolf, CBS Television, Rene Bras and Nicholas Webster

results.title: Tomorrow...today
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, James Jackson, Columbia Broadcasting System and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Examines the ways in which scientists simulate the future in order to solve tech;nological problems. Shows the lunar module of the Apollo project that landed on the moon, and demonstrates how the astronauts learned how to manoeuvre and land it. Also shows an airplane landing simulator, and a gymnast who simulates walking on the moon.
